meanings.definition: A person or animal with unkempt or ragged appearance.
meanings.sent1: The ragtail wandered the streets aimlessly, looking for food.
meanings.sent2: The stray dog had a ragtail and sad expression.
meanings.sent3: The ragtail cat tried to groom itself but only made its fur messier.
meanings.sent4: The old scarecrow in the field had a ragtail of tattered clothes blowing in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The ragtail beggar sat on the corner, hoping for some kindness from passersby.

meanings.sent1: The ragtail of mischievous kids caused trouble in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The ragtag group of pirates had a ragtail of mismatched clothing.
meanings.sent3: The ragtail of students in the back of the class whispered and giggled.
meanings.sent4: The ragtail of clouds in the sky looked like a messy painting.
meanings.sent5: The ragtail of protesters marched down the street, chanting slogans.

meanings.sent1: The teacher would ragtail the students who misbehaved in class.
meanings.sent2: She didn't mean to ragtail her friend, but she was frustrated.
meanings.sent3: The coach would ragtail the players when they didn't give their best effort.
meanings.sent4: The boss would ragtail employees who were consistently late to work.
meanings.sent5: The judge would ragtail those who broke the law in his courtroom.
